data.text: @bballguy1985 @scottdavidherr High risk is a 7 day average of more than 100 new cases per 100K.  At the state level that would be a 7 day average of greater ~2,200 new cases. Florida's 7 day average is still well above that. https://t.co/ptQkz4iSta

@scottdavidherr Why are that many counties listed as Substantial or high when Florida is now having less than 3000 new cases per day and the positivity rate is now under 10%.  New cases per day is now below 20 per 100,000. Most counties should be in the "Moderate" group if not "Low".
@scottdavidherr By the lens through which we used to see these numbers before we collectively became so numb, it’s still astronomical.
